010package imagingbook.lib.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
027
028import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.DivideByZeroException;
029import imagingbook.lib.math.eigen.RealEigensolver;
030import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
031
032/**
033 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
034 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
035 * objects structures. 
036 * Matrices are simply two-dimensional arrays A[r][c], where r is the row index
037 * and c is the column index (as common in linear algebra). This means that
038 * matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
039 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
040 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).</p>
041 * 
042 * <p>Methods named with a trailing 'D' (e.g., {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) 
043 * operate destructively, i.e., modify one of the passed arguments.</p>
044 * 
045 * <p>Most methods are self-explanatory and are therefore left undocumented.</p>
046 * 
047 * @see RealEigensolver
048 * @author W. Burger
049 * @version 2021/10/10
050 */
051public abstract class Matrix {
052        
053        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers. */
054        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
055        
056        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements. */
057        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
058        
059        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
060        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
061        
062        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
063        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
064        
065        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
066        
067        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
068                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
069                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
070                        return A;
071                }
072                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
073                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
074                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
075                }
076                
077                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
078                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
079                                A[r][c] = values[i];
080                                i++;
081                        }
082                }               
083                return A;
084        }
085        
086        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
087                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
088                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
089                        return A;
090                }
091                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
092                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
093                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
094                }       
095                
096                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
097                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
098                                A[r][c] = values[i];
099                                i++;
100                        }
101                }               
102                return A;
103        }
104        
105        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
106                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
107        }
108        
109        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
110                return values;
111        }
112        
113        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
114                return values;
115        }
116        
117        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
118                //return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
119                return new ArrayRealVector(values);
120        }
121        
122        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
123        
124        /**
125         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double} vector of the 
126         * specified length.
127         * @param length the length of the vector
128         * @return a vector with zero values
129         */
130        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
131                if (length < 1)
132                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
133                return new double[length];
134        }
135        
136        /**
137         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
138         * specified size.
139         * @param size the size of the matrix
140         * @return an identity matrix
141         */
142        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
143                if (size < 1)
144                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
145                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
146                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
147                        A[i][i] = 1;
148                }
149                return A;
150        }
151        
152        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
153
154        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
155                return A.length;
156        }
157        
158        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
159                return A[0].length;
160        }
161        
162        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
163                return A.length;
164        }
165        
166        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
167                return A[0].length;
168        }
169        
170        // Extract rows or columns
171        
172        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
173                return A[r].clone();
174        }
175        
176        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
177                final int rows = A.length;
178                double[] col = new double[rows];
179                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
180                        col[r] = A[r][c];
181                }
182                return col;
183        }
184        
185        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
186        
187        /**
188         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
189         * @param A a matrix
190         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
191         */
192        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
193                final int nCols = A[0].length;
194                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
195                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
196                                return false;
197                        }
198                }
199                return true;
200        }
201        
202        /**
203         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
204         * @param A a matrix
205         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
206         */
207        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
208                final int nCols = A[0].length;
209                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
210                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
211                                return false;
212                        }
213                }
214                return true;
215        }
216        
217        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
218         * and columns.
219         * @param A a matrix
220         * @return true iff the matrix is square
221         */
222        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
223                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
224        }
225        
226        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
227         * and columns.
228         * @param A a matrix
229         * @return true iff the matrix is square
230         */
231        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
232                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
233        }
234        
235        /**
236         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
237         * @param A a square matrix
238         * @return true if the matrix is non-singular
239         */
240        public static boolean isNonSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
241                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
242                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
243                }               
244                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A)).getSolver();              
245                return solver.isNonSingular();
246        }
247        
248        /**
249         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
250         * @param a first vector
251         * @param b second vector
252         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
253         */
254        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
255                return a.length == b.length;
256        }
257        
258        /**
259         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
260         * @param a first vector
261         * @param b second vector
262         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
263         */
264        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
265                return a.length == b.length;
266        }
267        
268        /**
269         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
270         * @param A first matrix
271         * @param B second matrix
272         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
273         */
274        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
275                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
276        }
277        
278        /**
279         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
280         * @param A first matrix
281         * @param B second matrix
282         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
283         */
284        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
285                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
286        }
287
288        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
289
290        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] A) {
291                return A.clone();
292        }
293        
294        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] A) {
295                return A.clone();
296        }
297
298        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
299                final int m = A.length;
300                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
301                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
302                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
303                }
304                return B;
305        }
306        
307        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
308                final int m = A.length;
309                float[][] B = new float[m][];
310                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
311                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
312                }
313                return B;
314        }
315        
316        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
317        
318        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] A) {
319                final int m = A.length;
320                final float[] B = new float[m];
321                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
322                        B[i] = (float) A[i];
323                }
324                return B;
325        }
326        
327        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
328                final int m = A.length;
329                final int n = A[0].length;
330                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
331                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
332                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
333                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
334                        }
335                }
336                return B;
337        }
338        
339        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] A) {
340                final int m = A.length;
341                final double[] B = new double[m];
342                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
343                        B[i] = A[i];
344                }
345                return B;
346        }
347        
348        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
349                final int m = A.length;
350                final int n = A[0].length;
351                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
352                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
353                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
354                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
355                        }
356                }
357                return B;
358        }
359        
360        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
361        
362        public static void fillD(final float[] A, float val) {
363                Arrays.fill(A, val);
364        }
365        
366        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
367                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
368                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
369                }
370        }
371        
372        public static void fillD(final double[] A, double val) {
373                Arrays.fill(A, val);
374        }
375        
376        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
377                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
378                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
379                }
380        }
381        
382        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
383        
384        // non-destructive
385        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
386                double[] c = b.clone();
387                addD(a, c);
388                return c;
389        }
390        
391        // destructive, b is modified
392        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
393                if (!sameSize(a, b))
394                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
395                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
396                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
397                }
398        }
399        
400        // non-destructive
401        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
402                float[] c = b.clone();
403                addD(a, c);
404                return c;
405        }
406        
407        // destructive, b is modified
408        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
409                if (!sameSize(a, b))
410                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
411                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
412                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
413                }
414        }
415
416        // non-destructive
417        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
418                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
419                addD(A, C);
420                return C;
421        }
422        
423        // destructive, B is modified
424        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
425                if (!sameSize(A, B))
426                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
427                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
428                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
429                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
430                        }
431                }
432        }
433        
434        // non-destructive
435        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
436                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
437                addD(A, C);
438                return C;
439        }
440        
441        // destructive, B is modified
442        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
443                if (!sameSize(A, B))
444                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
445                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
446                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
447                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
448                        }
449                }
450        }
451        
452        // ------------------------------------------------
453        
454        // non-destructive a - b
455        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
456                if (!sameSize(a, b))
457                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
458                final int n = a.length;
459                double[] c = new double[n];
460                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
461                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
462                }
463                return c;
464        }
465        
466        // non-destructive a - b
467        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
468                if (!sameSize(a, b))
469                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
470                final int n = a.length;
471                float[] c = new float[n];
472                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
473                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
474                }
475                return c;
476        }
477
478        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
479
480        // non-destructive
481        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] a) {
482                double[] b = a.clone();
483                multiplyD(s, b);
484                return b;
485        }
486        
487        // destructive
488        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] a) {
489                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
490                        a[i] = a[i] * s;
491                }
492        }
493        
494
495        // non-destructive
496        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
497                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
498                multiplyD(s, B);
499                return B;
500        }
501        
502        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
503                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
504                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
505                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
506                        }
507                }
508        }
509        
510        // non-destructive
511        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] A) {
512                float[] B = duplicate(A);
513                multiplyD(s, B);
514                return B;
515        }
516        
517        // destructive
518        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] A) {
519                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
520                        A[i] = A[i] * s;
521                }
522        }
523
524        // non-destructive
525        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
526                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
527                multiplyD(s, B);
528                return B;
529        }
530        
531        // destructive
532        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
533                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
534                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
535                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
536                        }
537                }
538        }
539        
540        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
541
542        /**
543         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A from the right, i.e., y = x * A,
544         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
545         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
546         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
547         * @return a (row) vector of length n
548         */
549        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
550                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
551                multiplyD(x, A, y);
552                return y;
553        }
554        
555        /**
556         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
557         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
558         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
559         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
560         */
561        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException {
562                if (x == y) 
563                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
564                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
565                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
566                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
567                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
568                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
569                        double s = 0;
570                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
571                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
572                        }
573                        y[i] = s;
574                }
575        }
576
577        /**
578         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
579         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
580         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
581         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
582         * @return a (column) vector of length m
583         */
584        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
585                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
586                multiplyD(A, x, y);
587                return y;
588        }
589        
590        /**
591         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
592         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
593         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
594         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
595         */
596        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
597                if (x == y) 
598                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
599                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
600                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
601                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
602                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
603                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
604                        double s = 0;
605                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
606                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
607                        }
608                        y[i] = s;
609                }
610        }
611        
612        /**
613         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
614         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
615         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
616         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
617         * @return a (column) vector of length m
618         */
619        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
620                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
621                multiplyD(A, x, y);
622                return y;
623        }
624        
625        /**
626         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
627         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
628         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
629         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
630         */
631        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
632                if (x == y) 
633                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
634                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
635                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
636                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
637                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
638                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
639                        double s = 0;
640                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
641                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
642                        }
643                        y[i] = (float) s;
644                }
645        }
646        
647
648        
649        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
650        
651        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
652        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
653                int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
654                int q = getNumberOfColumns(B);
655                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(m, q);
656                multiplyD(A, B, C);
657                return C;
658        }
659        
660        // A * B -> C (destructive)
661        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
662                if (A == C || B == C) 
663                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
664                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
665                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
666                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
667                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
668                if (nA != mB)
669                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
670                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
671                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
672                                double s = 0;
673                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
674                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
675                                }
676                                C[i][j] = s;
677                        }
678                }
679        }
680        
681        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
682        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
683                // TODO: also check nA = mB
684                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
685                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
686                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
687                multiplyD(A, B, C);
688                return C;
689        }
690
691        // A * B -> C (destructive)
692        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
693                if (A == C || B == C) 
694                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
695                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
696                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
697                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
698                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
699                if (nA != mB)
700                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
701                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
702                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
703                                float s = 0;
704                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
705                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
706                                }
707                                C[i][j] = s;
708                        }
709                }
710        }
711        
712        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
713        
714        /**
715         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
716         * which must have the same length.
717         * @param x first vector
718         * @param y second vector
719         * @return the dot product
720         */
721        public static double dotProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
722                if (!sameSize(x, y))
723                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
724                double sum = 0;
725                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
726                        sum = sum + x[i] * y[i];
727                }
728                return sum;
729        }
730        
731        // A is considered a column vector, B is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
732        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
733        /**
734         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
735         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
736         * m is the length of the second vector.
737         * @param x first vector (of length m)
738         * @param y second vector (of length n)
739         * @return the outer product (matrix)
740         */
741        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
742                final int m = x.length;
743                final int n = y.length;
744                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
745                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
746                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
747                                M[i][j] = x[i] * y[j];
748                        }
749                }
750                return M;
751        }
752
753        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
754
755        /**
756         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
757         * @param x a vector
758         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
759         */
760        public static double normL1(final double[] x) {
761                double sum = 0;
762                for (double val : x) {
763                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
764                }
765                return sum;
766        }
767
768        /**
769         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
770         * @param x a vector
771         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
772         */
773        public static double normL2(final double[] x) {
774                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
775        }
776
777        /**
778         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
779         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
780         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
781         * @param x a vector
782         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
783         */
784        public static double normL2squared(final double[] x) {
785                double sum = 0;
786                for (double val : x) {
787                        sum = sum + (val * val);
788                }
789                return sum;
790        }
791        
792        /**
793         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
794         * @param x a vector
795         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
796         */
797        public static float normL1(final float[] x) {
798                double sum = 0;
799                for (double val : x) {
800                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
801                }
802                return (float) sum;
803        }
804
805        /**
806         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
807         * @param x a vector
808         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
809         */
810        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
811                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
812        }
813
814        /**
815         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
816         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
817         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
818         * @param x a vector
819         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
820         */
821        public static float normL2squared(final float[] x) {
822                double sum = 0;
823                for (double val : x) {
824                        sum = sum + (val * val);
825                }
826                return (float) sum;
827        }
828        
829        // Normalize vectors
830        
831        public static double[] normalize(final double[] x) {
832                double[] xx = duplicate(x);
833                normalizeD(xx);
834                return xx;
835        }
836        
837        public static void normalizeD(final double[] x) {
838                multiplyD(1.0 / normL2(x), x);
839        }
840        
841        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
842        
843        /** 
844         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
845         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
846         * number of elements.
847         * @param x first vector
848         * @param y second vector
849         * @return the distance
850         */
851        public static double distL2(double[] x, double[] y) {
852                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
853        }
854        
855        /** 
856         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
857         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
858         * number of elements.
859         * @param x first vector
860         * @param y second vector
861         * @return the squared distance
862         */
863        public static double distL2squared(double[] x, double[] y) {
864                double sum = 0;
865                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
866                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
867                }
868                return sum;
869        }
870        
871        /** 
872         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
873         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
874         * number of elements.
875         * @param x first vector
876         * @param y second vector
877         * @return the distance
878         */
879        public static float distL2(float[] x, float[] y) {
880                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
881        }
882        
883        /** 
884         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
885         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
886         * number of elements.
887         * @param x first vector
888         * @param y second vector
889         * @return the squared distance
890         */
891        public static float distL2squared(float[] x, float[] y) {
892                double sum = 0;
893                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
894                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
895                }
896                return (float) sum;
897        }
898        
899        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
900        
901        /**
902         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
903         * @param A a matrix
904         * @return the norm of the matrix
905         */
906        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
907                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
908                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
909                double s = 0;
910                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
911                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
912                                s = s + A[i][j] * A[i][j];
913                        }
914                }
915                return Math.sqrt(s);
916        }
917
918        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
919
920        public static double sum(final double[] x) {
921                double sum = 0;
922                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
923                        sum = sum + x[i];
924                }
925                return sum;
926        }
927        
928        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
929                double sum = 0;
930                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
931                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
932                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
933                        }
934                }
935                return sum;
936        }
937        
938        public static float sum(final float[] x) {
939                double sum = 0;
940                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
941                        sum = sum + x[i];
942                }
943                return (float) sum;
944        }
945        
946        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
947                double sum = 0;
948                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
949                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
950                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
951                        }
952                }
953                return sum;
954        }
955        
956        // --------------------------------------------------
957        
958        /**
959         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
960         * @param A a matrix
961         * @param row the row index
962         * @return the sum of the row's elements
963         */
964        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
965                return sum(A[row]);
966        }
967        
968        /**
969         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
970         * @param A a matrix
971         * @param row the row index
972         * @return the sum of the row's elements
973         */
974        public static float sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
975                return sum(A[row]);
976        }
977        
978
979        /**
980         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
981         * @param A a matrix
982         * @param col the column index
983         * @return the sum of the column's elements
984         */
985        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
986                double sum = 0;
987                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
988                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
989                }
990                return sum;
991        }
992        
993        /**
994         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
995         * @param A a matrix
996         * @param col the column index
997         * @return the sum of the column's elements
998         */
999        public static float sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1000                double sum = 0;
1001                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1002                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1003                }
1004                return (float) sum;
1005        }
1006        
1007        /**
1008         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1009         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1010         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1011         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1012         */
1013        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1014                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1015                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1016                        double sum = 0;
1017                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1018                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1019                        }
1020                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1021                }
1022                return sumVec;
1023        }
1024        
1025        /**
1026         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1027         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1028         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1029         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1030         */
1031        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1032                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1033                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1034                        double sum = 0;
1035                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1036                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1037                        }
1038                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1039                }
1040                return sumVec;
1041        }
1042        
1043        /**
1044         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1045         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1046         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1047         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1048         */
1049        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1050                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1051                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1052                        double sum = 0;
1053                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1054                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1055                        }
1056                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1057                }
1058                return sumVec;
1059        }
1060        
1061        /**
1062         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1063         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1064         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1065         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1066         */
1067        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
1068                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1069                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1070                        double sum = 0;
1071                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1072                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1073                        }
1074                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1075                }
1076                return sumVec;
1077        }
1078        
1079        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1080        
1081        // TODO:  testing,  add float version
1082        /**
1083         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1084         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1085         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1086         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1087         * 
1088         * @param x a vector
1089         * @return the index of the smallest value
1090         */
1091        public static int idxMin(double[] x) {
1092                if (x.length == 0)
1093                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1094                double minval = x[0];
1095                int minidx = 0;
1096                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1097                        if (x[i] < minval) {
1098                                minval = x[i];
1099                                minidx = i;
1100                        }
1101                }
1102                return minidx;
1103        }
1104        
1105        // TODO: testing, add float version
1106        /**
1107         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1108         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1109         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1110         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1111         * 
1112         * @param x a vector
1113         * @return the index of the largest value
1114         */
1115        public static int idxMax(double[] x) {
1116                if (x.length == 0)
1117                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1118                double maxval = x[0];
1119                int maxidx = 0;
1120                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1121                        if (x[i] > maxval) {
1122                                maxval = x[i];
1123                                maxidx = i;
1124                        }
1125                }
1126                return maxidx;
1127        }
1128        
1129        
1130        public static float min(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1131                if (x.length == 0)
1132                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1133                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1134                for (float val : x) {
1135                        if (val < minval) {
1136                                minval = val;
1137                        }
1138                }
1139                return minval;
1140        }
1141        
1142        public static double min(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1143                if (x.length == 0)
1144                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1145                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1146                for (double val : x) {
1147                        if (val < minval) {
1148                                minval = val;
1149                        }
1150                }
1151                return minval;
1152        }
1153        
1154
1155        
1156        public static float max(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1157                if (x.length == 0)
1158                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1159                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1160                for (float val : x) {
1161                        if (val > maxval) {
1162                                maxval = val;
1163                        }
1164                }
1165                return maxval;
1166        }
1167        
1168        public static double max(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1169                if (x.length == 0)
1170                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1171                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1172                for (double val : x) {
1173                        if (val > maxval) {
1174                                maxval = val;
1175                        }
1176                }
1177                return maxval;
1178        }
1179        
1180        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1181                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1182                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1183                        for (double val : A[r]) {
1184                                if (val > maxval) {
1185                                        maxval = val;
1186                                }
1187                        }
1188                }
1189                return maxval;
1190        }
1191        
1192        public static float max(float[][] A) {
1193                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1194                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1195                        for (float val : A[r]) {
1196                                if (val > maxval) {
1197                                        maxval = val;
1198                                }
1199                        }
1200                }
1201                return maxval;
1202        }
1203        
1204        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
1205        
1206        /**
1207         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1208         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1209         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1210         */
1211        public static float[] join(float[]... xs) {
1212                int n = 0;
1213                for (float[] x : xs) {
1214                        n = n + x.length;
1215                }
1216                float[] va = new float[n];
1217                int j = 0;
1218                for (float[] x : xs) {
1219                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1220                                va[j] = x[i];
1221                                j++;
1222                        }
1223                }               
1224                return va;
1225        }
1226
1227        /**
1228         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1229         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1230         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1231         */
1232        public static double[] join(double[]... xs) {
1233                int n = 0;
1234                for (double[] x : xs) {
1235                        n = n + x.length;
1236                }
1237                double[] va = new double[n];    
1238                int j = 0;
1239                for (double[] x : xs) {
1240                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1241                                va[j] = x[i];
1242                                j++;
1243                        }
1244                }               
1245                return va;
1246        }
1247        
1248        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
1249        
1250        /**
1251         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1252         * which must have the same length.
1253         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1254         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1255         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1256         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1257         * @return the interpolated vector
1258         */
1259        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
1260                float[] c = new float[a.length];
1261                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1262                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1263                }
1264                return c;
1265        }
1266        
1267        /**
1268         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1269         * which must have the same length.
1270         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1271         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1272         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1273         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1274         * @return the interpolated vector
1275         */
1276        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
1277                double[] c = new double[a.length];
1278                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1279                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1280                }
1281                return c;
1282        }
1283        
1284        
1285        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
1286        
1287        /**
1288         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
1289         * vector, which contains an additional 1-element.
1290         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
1291         * @param xc a Cartesian vector
1292         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
1293         */
1294        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] xc) {
1295                double[] xh = new double[xc.length + 1];
1296                for (int i = 0; i < xc.length; i++) {
1297                        xh[i] = xc[i];
1298                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
1299                }
1300                return xh;
1301        }
1302        
1303        /**
1304         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
1305         * vector, which is one element shorter.
1306         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
1307         * @param xh a homogeneous vector
1308         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
1309         */
1310        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] xh) throws DivideByZeroException {
1311                double[] xc = new double[xh.length - 1];
1312                final double s = 1 / xh[xh.length - 1];
1313                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
1314                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
1315                for (int i = 0; i < xh.length - 1; i++) {
1316                        xc[i] = s * xh[i];
1317                }
1318                return xc;
1319        }
1320        
1321        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
1322        
1323        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1324                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1325                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1326                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1327        }
1328        
1329        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1330                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1331                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1332                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1333        }
1334        
1335        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1336                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1337                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1338                return
1339                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
1340                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
1341                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
1342                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
1343                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
1344                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1345        }
1346
1347        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1348                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1349                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1350                return 
1351                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
1352                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
1353                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
1354                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
1355                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
1356                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1357        }
1358        
1359        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1360                if (!isSquare(A))
1361                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1362                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1363                return new LUDecomposition(M).getDeterminant();
1364        }
1365        
1366        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
1367        
1368        public static double trace(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1369                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1370                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1371                if (m != n) 
1372                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1373                double s = 0;
1374                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1375                                s = s + A[i][i];
1376                }
1377                return s;
1378        }
1379        
1380        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
1381        
1382        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
1383                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1384                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1385                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
1386                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1387                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1388                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1389                        }
1390                }
1391                return At;
1392        }
1393        
1394        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
1395                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1396                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1397                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
1398                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1399                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1400                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1401                        }
1402                }
1403                return At;
1404        }
1405        
1406        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
1407        
1408        public static boolean isZero(double[] x, double tolerance) {
1409                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1410                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
1411                                return false;
1412                        }
1413                }
1414                return true;
1415        }
1416        
1417        public static boolean isZero(double[] x) {
1418                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
1419        }
1420        
1421        public static boolean isZero(float[] x, float tolerance) {
1422                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1423                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
1424                                return false;
1425                        }
1426                }
1427                return true;
1428        }
1429        
1430        public static boolean isZero(float[] x) {
1431                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
1432        }
1433        
1434        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
1435        
1436        /**
1437         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1438         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
1439         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1440         * @param A a square matrix
1441         * @return the inverse matrix
1442         */
1443        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1444                if (!isSquare(A))
1445                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1446                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1447                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
1448        }
1449        
1450        /**
1451         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1452         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
1453         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1454         * @param A a square matrix
1455         * @return the inverse matrix
1456         */
1457        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1458                if (!isSquare(A))
1459                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1460                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
1461                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
1462        }
1463
1464        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
1465        
1466        /**
1467         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
1468         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
1469         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
1470         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
1471         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library.
1472         * 
1473         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
1474         * @param b a vector of length n
1475         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
1476         */
1477        
1478        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
1479                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
1480                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
1481                        throw new RuntimeException("matrix A must be square");
1482                }
1483                if (x == null) {
1484                        return null;
1485                }
1486                else {
1487                        return x.toArray();
1488                }
1489        }
1490        
1491        /**
1492         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
1493         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
1494         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
1495         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
1496         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library
1497         * (with singularity threshold set to zero).
1498         * 
1499         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
1500         * @param b a vector of length n
1501         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
1502         */
1503        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
1504                if (!A.isSquare()) {
1505                        throw new RuntimeException("matrix A must be square");
1506                }
1507                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
1508                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1509                }
1510                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
1511                RealVector x = null;
1512                try {
1513                        x = solver.solve(b);
1514                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
1515                return x;
1516        }
1517        
1518        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
1519        
1520        public static String toString(double[] x) {
1521                if (x == null) {
1522                        return String.valueOf(x);
1523                }
1524                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1525                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1526                printToStream(x, strm);
1527                return bas.toString();
1528        }
1529        
1530        public static String toString(float[] x) {
1531                if (x == null) {
1532                        return String.valueOf(x);
1533                }
1534                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1535                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1536                printToStream(x, strm);
1537                return bas.toString();
1538        }
1539        
1540        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
1541                if (A == null) {
1542                        return String.valueOf(A);
1543                }
1544                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1545                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1546                printToStream(A, strm);
1547                return bas.toString();
1548        }
1549        
1550        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
1551                if (A == null) {
1552                        return String.valueOf(A);
1553                }
1554                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1555                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1556                printToStream(A, strm);
1557                return bas.toString();
1558        }
1559        
1560        public static String toString(RealVector x) {
1561                if (x == null) {
1562                        return String.valueOf(x);
1563                }
1564                else {
1565                        return toString(x.toArray());
1566                }
1567        }
1568        
1569        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {
1570                if (A == null) {
1571                        return String.valueOf(A);
1572                }
1573                else {
1574                        return toString(A.getData());
1575                }
1576        }
1577        
1578        // --------------------
1579        
1580        public static void printToStream(double[] x, PrintStream strm) {
1581                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1582                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1583                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1584                        if (i > 0)
1585                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1586                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, x[i]);
1587                }
1588                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1589                strm.flush();
1590        }
1591        
1592        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1593                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1594                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1595                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1596                        if (i == 0)
1597                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1598                        else
1599                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1600                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
1601                                if (j == 0) 
1602                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1603                                else
1604                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1605                        }
1606                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1607                }
1608                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1609                strm.flush();
1610        }
1611        
1612        public static void printToStream(float[] A, PrintStream strm) {
1613                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1614                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1615                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1616                        if (i > 0)
1617                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1618                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i]);
1619                }
1620                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1621                strm.flush();
1622        }
1623        
1624        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1625                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1626                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1627                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1628                        if (i == 0)
1629                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1630                        else
1631                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1632                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1633                                if (j == 0) 
1634                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1635                                else
1636                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1637                        }
1638                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1639                }
1640                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1641                strm.flush();
1642        }
1643
1644        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
1645        
1646        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {
1647                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1648                
1649                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
1650                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
1651                }
1652        }
1653        
1654        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
1655                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1656                
1657                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
1658                        super("square matrix expected");
1659                }
1660        }
1661        
1662        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
1663                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1664                
1665                public SameSourceTargetException() {
1666                        super("source and target must not be the same");
1667                }
1668        }
1669        
1670        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {
1671                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1672                
1673                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
1674                        super("vector length must be greater that 0");
1675                }
1676        }
1677        
1678        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
1679        
1680        public static void main(String[] args) {
1681                double s = Double.NaN;
1682                s = -1.0 / 1E-200; // / 1E-200;
1683                System.out.println(Double.isFinite(s));
1684                System.out.println((double[]) null);
1685                
1686                double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(5, 4,
1687                                1,2,3,4,
1688                                5,6,7,8,
1689                                9,10,11,12,
1690                                13,14,15,16,
1691                                17,18,19,20);
1692                System.out.println("A = \n" + toString(A));
1693                
1694                RealMatrix B = makeRealMatrix(5, 4);
1695                System.out.println("B = \n" + toString(B.getData()));
1696
1697        }

1699}
